summary.title: Fitness App
summary.description: A threat model for our SEP3 project. The system is described in detail in the Project description and Project, Process, and Scrum reports.

cells.description: An unauthorized user
.razor page for registering a new member

threats.title: Vulnerability scanning
threats.description: Examination of the application in order to find weaknesses and points where a security vulnerability might exist

threats.title: Denial of Service
threats.description: Usage may appear as a legitimate application usage but leads to exhaustion of resources
threats.mitigation: Mitigation and/or prevention such as providing backup, resource management

threats.title: Footprinting
threats.description: Information gathering with the objective of learning as much as possible about the configuration and security mechanisms of the application
threats.mitigation: Defences include shutting down unnecessary services and ports and excluding information that could identify and compromise security of the organisation

SQLite database created and accessed through EFC

threats.title: Scraping
threats.description: Collecting accessible data and/or processed output from the application
threats.mitigation: Ensure information is accessible only with authentication and authorisation

threats.title: Spamming
threats.description: Storing malicious information such as embedded code, malware, etc.
threats.mitigation: Defences include detecting embedded malicious code, controling interaction frequency and enforcement of a single unique action

cells.description: A create operation that creates a new member
log the data flow and exceptions. each server has its own

threats.title: Logs contain sensitive data
threats.description: Logs are read by unauthorised users or made public, sensitive data is then disclosed
threats.mitigation: Minimise any sensitive data contained in logs
